alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 9:13AM EST until February 01 at 12:03AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Tucsawhatchee Creek near Hawkinsville affecting Pulaski County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tucsawhatchee Creek near Hawkinsville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands...fields and pastures begin upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highways 257 and 27. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.6 feet and rising slowly. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 11.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
